articles.title: High cholesterol levels: Why taking your medicine diligently is more effective than changing your diet - Channel NewsAsia
articles.description: A local study revealed medicine is 85 per cent effective compared to exercise and diet (10 per cent to 20 per cent). A doctor also breaks down misconceptions about statins, the most commonly prescribed medicine.
articles.content:
HOW DO THESE MEDICINES WORK?
In Singapore, nearly two out of 10 adults aged 18 to 69 have high cholesterol, according to the SHP study. 
If youre one of them, youre probably put on statins (includi… [+686 chars]
